<h3><a id="user-content-notable-changes" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#notable-changes"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Notable Changes</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>deps</strong>:
<ul>
<li>update ICU to 64.2 (Ujjwal Sharma) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/27361">#27361</a></li>
<li>upgrade npm to 6.9.0 (Kat MarchÃ¡n) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/26244">#26244</a></li>
<li>upgrade openssl sources to 1.1.1b (Sam Roberts) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/26327">#26327</a></li>
<li>upgrade to libuv 1.28.0 (cjihrig) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/27241">#27241</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>events</strong>: add once method to use promises with EventEmitter (Matteo Collina) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/26078">#26078</a></li>
<li><strong>n-api</strong>: mark thread-safe function as stable (Gabriel Schulhof) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/25556">#25556</a></li>
<li><strong>repl</strong>: support top-level for-await-of (Shelley Vohr) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/23841">#23841</a></li>
<li><strong>zlib</strong>:  add brotli support (Anna Henningsen) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/24938">#24938</a></li>
</ul>

<h2><a id="user-content-2019-02-28-version-10152-dubnium-lts-rvagg" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#2019-02-28-version-10152-dubnium-lts-rvagg"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>2019-02-28, Version 10.15.2 'Dubnium' (LTS), @rvagg</h2>
<p>This is a security release. All Node.js users should consult the security release summary at:</p>
<p><a href="https://nodejs.org/en/blog/vulnerability/february-2019-security-releases/" rel="nofollow">https://nodejs.org/en/blog/vulnerability/february-2019-security-releases/</a></p>
<p>for details on patched vulnerabilities.</p>
<p>A fix for the following CVE is included in this release:</p>
<ul>
<li>Node.js: Slowloris HTTP Denial of Service with keep-alive (CVE-2019-5737)</li>
</ul>
<h3><a id="user-content-notable-changes-2" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#notable-changes-2"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Notable Changes</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>http</strong>: Further prevention of "Slowloris" attacks on HTTP and HTTPS connections by consistently applying the receive timeout set by <code>server.headersTimeout</code> to connections in keep-alive mode. Reported by Marco Pracucci (<a href="https://voxnest.com" rel="nofollow">Voxnest</a>). (CVE-2019-5737 / Matteo Collina)</li>
</ul>
<h3><a id="user-content-commits-2" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#commits-2"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Commits</h3>

<h2><a id="user-content-2018-12-26-version-10150-dubnium-lts-mylesborins" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#2018-12-26-version-10150-dubnium-lts-mylesborins"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>2018-12-26, Version 10.15.0 'Dubnium' (LTS), @MylesBorins</h2>
<p>The 10.14.0 security release introduced some unexpected breakages on the 10.x release line.
This is a special release to fix a regression in the HTTP binary upgrade response body and add
a missing CLI flag to adjust the max header size of the http parser.</p>
<h3><a id="user-content-notable-changes-4" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#notable-changes-4"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Notable Changes</h3>

<li><strong>cli</strong>:
<ul>
<li>add --max-http-header-size flag (cjihrig) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/24811">#24811</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>http</strong>:
<ul>
<li>add maxHeaderSize property (cjihrig) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/24860">#24860</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<h2><a id="user-content-2018-11-27-version-10140-dubnium-lts-rvagg" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#2018-11-27-version-10140-dubnium-lts-rvagg"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>2018-11-27, Version 10.14.0 'Dubnium' (LTS), @rvagg</h2>
<p>This is a security release. All Node.js users should consult the security release summary at:</p>
<p><a href="https://nodejs.org/en/blog/vulnerability/november-2018-security-releases/" rel="nofollow">https://nodejs.org/en/blog/vulnerability/november-2018-security-releases/</a></p>
<p>for details on patched vulnerabilities.</p>
<p>Fixes for the following CVEs are included in this release:</p>
<ul>
<li>Node.js: Denial of Service with large HTTP headers (CVE-2018-12121)</li>
<li>Node.js: Slowloris HTTP Denial of Service (CVE-2018-12122 / Node.js)</li>
<li>Node.js: Hostname spoofing in URL parser for javascript protocol (CVE-2018-12123)</li>
<li>OpenSSL: Timing vulnerability in DSA signature generation (CVE-2018-0734)</li>
<li>OpenSSL: Timing vulnerability in ECDSA signature generation (CVE-2019-0735)</li>
</ul>
<h3><a id="user-content-notable-changes-7" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#notable-changes-7"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Notable Changes</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>deps</strong>: Upgrade to OpenSSL 1.1.0j, fixing CVE-2018-0734 and CVE-2019-0735</li>
<li><strong>http</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Headers received by HTTP servers must not exceed 8192 bytes in total to prevent possible Denial of Service attacks. Reported by Trevor Norris. (CVE-2018-12121 / Matteo Collina)</li>
<li>A timeout of 40 seconds now applies to servers receiving HTTP headers. This value can be adjusted with <code>server.headersTimeout</code>. Where headers are not completely received within this period, the socket is destroyed on the next received chunk. In conjunction with <code>server.setTimeout()</code>, this aids in protecting against excessive resource retention and possible Denial of Service. Reported by Jan Maybach (<a href="https://liebdich.com" rel="nofollow">liebdich.com</a>). (CVE-2018-12122 / Matteo Collina)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>url</strong>: Fix a bug that would allow a hostname being spoofed when parsing URLs with <code>url.parse()</code> with the <code>'javascript:'</code> protocol. Reported by <a href="https://twitter.com/_bayotop" rel="nofollow">Martin Bajanik</a> (<a href="https://kenticocloud.com/" rel="nofollow">Kentico</a>). (CVE-2018-12123 / Matteo Collina)</li>
</ul>

<h2><a id="user-content-2018-10-30-version-10130-dubnium-lts-mylesborins" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#2018-10-30-version-10130-dubnium-lts-mylesborins"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>2018-10-30, Version 10.13.0 'Dubnium' (LTS), @MylesBorins</h2>
<p>This release marks the transition of Node.js 10.x into Long Term
Support (LTS) with the codename 'Dubnium'. The 10.x release line
now moves in to "Active LTS" and will remain so until April 2020.
After that time it will move in to "Maintenance" until end of
life in April 2021.</p>
<h3><a id="user-content-notable-changes-8" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#notable-changes-8"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Notable Changes</h3>
<p>This release only includes minimal changes necessary to fix known regressions prior to LTS.</p>

<h2><a id="user-content-2018-10-10-version-10120-current-targos" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#2018-10-10-version-10120-current-targos"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>2018-10-10, Version 10.12.0 (Current), @targos</h2>
<h3><a id="user-content-notable-changes-9" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#notable-changes-9"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Notable changes</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>assert</strong>
<ul>
<li>The diff output is now a tiny bit improved by sorting object properties when
inspecting the values that are compared with each other. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/22788">#22788</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>cli</strong>
<ul>
<li>The options parser now normalizes <code>_</code> to <code>-</code> in all multi-word command-line
flags, e.g. <code>--no_warnings</code> has the same effect as <code>--no-warnings</code>. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/23020">#23020</a></li>
<li>Added bash completion for the <code>node</code> binary. To generate a bash completion
script, run <code>node --completion-bash</code>. The output can be saved to a file
which can be sourced to enable completion. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20713">#20713</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>crypto</strong>
<ul>
<li>Added support for PEM-level encryption. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/23151">#23151</a></li>
<li>Added an API asymmetric key pair generation. The new methods
<code>crypto.generateKeyPair</code> and <code>crypto.generateKeyPairSync</code> can be used to
generate public and private key pairs. The API supports RSA, DSA and EC and
a variety of key encodings (both PEM and DER). <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/22660">#22660</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>fs</strong>
<ul>
<li>Added a <code>recursive</code> option to <code>fs.mkdir</code> and <code>fs.mkdirSync</code>. If this option
is set to true, non-existing parent folders will be automatically created. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21875">#21875</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>http2</strong>
<ul>
<li>Added a <code>'ping'</code> event to <code>Http2Session</code> that is emitted whenever a non-ack
<code>PING</code> is received. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/23009">#23009</a></li>
<li>Added support for the <code>ORIGIN</code> frame. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/22956">#22956</a></li>
<li>Updated nghttp2 to 1.34.0. This adds RFC 8441 extended connect protocol
support to allow use of WebSockets over HTTP/2. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/23284">#23284</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>module</strong>
<ul>
<li>Added <code>module.createRequireFromPath(filename)</code>. This new method can be used
to create a custom require function that will resolve modules relative to
the filename path. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/19360">#19360</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>process</strong>
<ul>
<li>Added a <code>'multipleResolves'</code> process event that is emitted whenever a
<code>Promise</code> is attempted to be resolved multiple times, e.g. if the <code>resolve</code>
and <code>reject</code> functions are both called in a <code>Promise</code> executor. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/22218">#22218</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>url</strong>
<ul>
<li>Added <code>url.fileURLToPath(url)</code> and <code>url.pathToFileURL(path)</code>. These methods
can be used to correctly convert between file: URLs and absolute paths. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/22506">#22506</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>util</strong>
<ul>
<li>Added the <code>sorted</code> option to <code>util.inspect()</code>. If set to <code>true</code>, all
properties of an object and Set and Map entries will be sorted in the
returned string. If set to a function, it is used as a compare function. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/22788">#22788</a></li>
<li>The <code>util.instpect.custom</code> symbol is now defined in the global symbol
registry as <code>Symbol.for('nodejs.util.inspect.custom')</code>. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20857">#20857</a></li>
<li>Added support for <code>BigInt</code> numbers in <code>util.format()</code>. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/22097">#22097</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>V8 API</strong>
<ul>
<li>A number of V8 C++ APIs have been marked as deprecated since they have been
removed in the upstream repository. Replacement APIs are added where
necessary. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/23159">#23159</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>Windows</strong>
<ul>
<li>The Windows msi installer now provides an option to automatically install
the tools required to build native modules. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/22645">#22645</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>Workers</strong>
<ul>
<li>Debugging support for Workers using the DevTools protocol has been
implemented. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21364">#21364</a></li>
<li>The public <code>inspector</code> module is now enabled in Workers. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/22769">#22769</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>Added new collaborators</strong>:
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/digitalinfinity">digitalinfinity</a> - Hitesh Kanwathirtha</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<h2><a id="user-content-2018-09-06-version-10100-current-targos" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#2018-09-06-version-10100-current-targos"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>2018-09-06, Version 10.10.0 (Current), @targos</h2>
<h3><a id="user-content-notable-changes-11" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#notable-changes-11"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Notable Changes</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>child_process</strong>:
<ul>
<li><code>TypedArray</code> and <code>DataView</code> values are now accepted as input by
<code>execFileSync</code> and <code>spawnSync</code>. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/22409">#22409</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>coverage</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Native V8 code coverage information can now be output to disk by setting the
environment variable <code>NODE_V8_COVERAGE</code> to a directory. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/22527">#22527</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>deps</strong>:
<ul>
<li>The bundled npm was upgraded to version 6.4.1. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/22591">#22591</a>
<ul>
<li>Changelogs:
<a href="https://github.com/npm/cli/releases/tag/v6.3.0-next.0">6.3.0-next.0</a>
<a href="https://github.com/npm/cli/releases/tag/v6.3.0">6.3.0</a>
<a href="https://github.com/npm/cli/releases/tag/v6.4.0">6.4.0</a>
<a href="https://github.com/npm/cli/releases/tag/v6.4.1">6.4.1</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>fs</strong>:
<ul>
<li>The methods <code>fs.read</code>, <code>fs.readSync</code>, <code>fs.write</code>, <code>fs.writeSync</code>,
<code>fs.writeFile</code> and <code>fs.writeFileSync</code> now all accept <code>TypedArray</code> and
<code>DataView</code> objects. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/22150">#22150</a></li>
<li>A new boolean option, <code>withFileTypes</code>, can be passed to <code>fs.readdir</code> and
<code>fs.readdirSync</code>. If set to true, the methods return an array of directory
entries. These are objects that can be used to determine the type of each
entry and filter them based on that without calling <code>fs.stat</code>. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/22020">#22020</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>http2</strong>:
<ul>
<li>The <code>http2</code> module is no longer experimental. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/22466">#22466</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>os</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Added two new methods: <code>os.getPriority</code> and <code>os.setPriority</code>, allowing to
manipulate the scheduling priority of processes. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/22407">#22407</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>process</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Added <code>process.allowedNodeEnvironmentFlags</code>. This object can be used to
programmatically validate and list flags that are allowed in the
<code>NODE_OPTIONS</code> environment variable. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/19335">#19335</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>src</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Deprecated option variables in public C++ API. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/22515">#22515</a></li>
<li>Refactored options parsing. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/22392">#22392</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>vm</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Added <code>vm.compileFunction</code>, a method to create new JavaScript functions from
a source body, with options similar to those of the other <code>vm</code> methods. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21571">#21571</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>Added new collaborators</strong>:
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/lundibundi">lundibundi</a> - Denys Otrishko</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<h2><a id="user-content-2018-08-15-version-1090-current-rvagg" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#2018-08-15-version-1090-current-rvagg"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>2018-08-15, Version 10.9.0 (Current), @rvagg</h2>
<p>This is a security release. All Node.js users should consult the security release summary at:</p>
<p><a href="https://nodejs.org/en/blog/vulnerability/august-2018-security-releases/" rel="nofollow">https://nodejs.org/en/blog/vulnerability/august-2018-security-releases/</a></p>
<p>for details on patched vulnerabilities.</p>
<p>Fixes for the following CVEs are included in this release:</p>
<ul>
<li>CVE-2018-0732 (OpenSSL)</li>
<li>CVE-2018-7166 (Node.js)</li>
<li>CVE-2018-12115 (Node.js)</li>
</ul>
<h3><a id="user-content-notable-changes-12" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#notable-changes-12"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Notable Changes</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>buffer</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Fix out-of-bounds (OOB) write in <code>Buffer.write()</code> for UCS-2 encoding (CVE-2018-12115)</li>
<li>Fix unintentional exposure of uninitialized memory in <code>Buffer.alloc()</code> (CVE-2018-7166)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>deps</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Upgrade to OpenSSL 1.1.0i, fixing:
<ul>
<li>Client DoS due to large DH parameter (CVE-2018-0732)</li>
<li>ECDSA key extraction via local side-channel (CVE not assigned)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Upgrade V8 from 6.7 to 6.8 (MichaÃ«l Zasso) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21079">#21079</a>
<ul>
<li>Memory reduction and performance improvements, details at: <a href="https://v8project.blogspot.com/2018/06/v8-release-68.html" rel="nofollow">https://v8project.blogspot.com/2018/06/v8-release-68.html</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>http</strong>: <code>http.get()</code> and <code>http.request()</code> (and <code>https</code> variants) can now accept three arguments to allow for a <code>URL</code> <em>and</em> an <code>options</code> object (Sam Ruby) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21616">#21616</a></li>
<li>Added new collaborators
<ul>
<li>Sam Ruby (<a href="https://github.com/rubys">https://github.com/rubys</a>)</li>
<li>George Adams (<a href="https://github.com/gdams">https://github.com/gdams</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li><strong>deps</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Upgrade npm to 6.2.0. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21592">#21592</a>
<ul>
<li>npm has moved. This release updates various URLs to point to the right
places for bugs, support, and PRs.</li>
<li>Fix the regular expression matching in <code>xcode_emulation</code> in <code>node-gyp</code> to
also handle version numbers with multiple-digit major versions which would
otherwise break under use of XCode 10.</li>
<li>The npm tree has been <em>significantly</em> flattened. Tarball size for the npm
package has gone from 8MB to 4.8MB.</li>
<li>Changelogs:
<a href="https://github.com/npm/npm/releases/tag/v6.2.0-next.0">6.2.0-next.0</a>,
<a href="https://github.com/npm/npm/releases/tag/v6.2.0-next.1">6.2.0-next.1</a>,
<a href="https://github.com/npm/cli/releases/tag/v6.2.0">6.2.0</a>.</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<h3><a id="user-content-notable-changes-14" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#notable-changes-14"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Notable Changes</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>console</strong>:
<ul>
<li>The <code>console.timeLog()</code> method has been implemented. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21312">#21312</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>deps</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Upgrade to libuv 1.22.0. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21731">#21731</a></li>
<li>Upgrade to ICU 62.1 (Unicode 11, CLDR 33.1). <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21728">#21728</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>http</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Added support for passing both <code>timeout</code> and <code>agent</code> options to
<code>http.request</code>. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21204">#21204</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>inspector</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Expose the original console API in <code>require('inspector').console</code>. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21659">#21659</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>napi</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Added experimental support for functions dealing with bigint numbers. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21226">#21226</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>process</strong>:
<ul>
<li>The <code>process.hrtime.bigint()</code> method has been implemented. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21256">#21256</a></li>
<li>Added the <code>--title</code> command line argument to set the process title on
startup. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21477">#21477</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>trace_events</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Added process_name metadata. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21477">#21477</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>Added new collaborators</strong>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/codebytere">codebytere</a> - Shelley Vohr</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<h2><a id="user-content-2018-07-04-version-1060-current-targos" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#2018-07-04-version-1060-current-targos"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>2018-07-04, Version 10.6.0 (Current), @targos</h2>
<h3><a id="user-content-notable-changes-15" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#notable-changes-15"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Notable Changes</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>dns</strong>:
<ul>
<li>An experimental promisified version of the dns module is now available. Give
it a try with <code>require('dns').promises</code>. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21264">#21264</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>fs</strong>:
<ul>
<li><code>fs.lchown</code> has been undeprecated now that libuv supports it. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21498">#21498</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>lib</strong>:
<ul>
<li><code>Atomics.wake</code> is being renamed to <code>Atomics.notify</code> in the ECMAScript
specification (<a href="https://github.com/tc39/ecma262/pull/1220">reference</a>).
Since Node.js now has experimental support for worker threads, we are being
proactive and added a <code>notify</code> alias, while emitting a warning if
<code>wake</code> is used. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21413">#21413</a> <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21518">#21518</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>n-api</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Add API for asynchronous functions. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/17887">#17887</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>util</strong>:
<ul>
<li><code>util.inspect</code> is now able to return a result instead of throwing when the
maximum call stack size is exceeded during inspection. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20725">#20725</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>vm</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Add <code>script.createCachedData()</code>. This API replaces the <code>produceCachedData</code>
option of the <code>Script</code> constructor that is now deprecated. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20300">#20300</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>worker</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Support for relative paths has been added to the <code>Worker</code> constructor. Paths
are interpreted relative to the current working directory. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/21407">#21407</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<h3><a id="user-content-notable-changes-16" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#notable-changes-16"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Notable Changes</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>crypto</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Support for <code>crypto.scrypt()</code> has been added. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20816">#20816</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>fs</strong>:
<ul>
<li>BigInt support has been added to <code>fs.stat</code> and <code>fs.watchFile</code>. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20220">#20220</a></li>
<li>APIs that take <code>mode</code> as arguments no longer throw on values larger than
<code>0o777</code>. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20636">#20636</a> <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20975">#20975</a> (Fixes: <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/20498">#20498</a>)</li>
<li>Fix crashes in closed event watchers. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20985">#20985</a> (Fixes: <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/20297">#20297</a>)</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>Worker Threads</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Support for multi-threading has been added behind the
<code>--experimental-worker</code> flag in the <code>worker_threads</code> module. This feature
is <em>experimental</em> and may receive breaking changes at any time. <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20876">#20876</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<h3><a id="user-content-notable-changes-17" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#notable-changes-17"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Notable Changes</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>Fixes memory exhaustion DoS</strong> (CVE-2018-7164): Fixes a bug introduced in 9.7.0 that increases the memory consumed when reading from the network into JavaScript using the net.Socket object directly as a stream.</li>
<li><strong>http2</strong>
<ul>
<li>(CVE-2018-7161): Fixes Denial of Service vulnerability by updating the http2 implementation to not crash under certain circumstances during cleanup</li>
<li>(CVE-2018-1000168): Fixes Denial of Service vulnerability by upgrading nghttp2 to 1.32.0</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>tls</strong> (CVE-2018-7162): Fixes Denial of Service vulnerability by updating the TLS implementation to not crash upon receiving</li>
<li><strong>n-api</strong>: Prevent use-after-free in napi_delete_async_work</li>
</ul>

<p>This is a follow up release to fix two regressions that were introduced in v10.2.0.</p>

<h2><a id="user-content-2018-05-23-version-1020-current-mylesborins" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#2018-05-23-version-1020-current-mylesborins"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>2018-05-23, Version 10.2.0 (Current), @MylesBorins</h2>
<h3><a id="user-content-notable-changes-21" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#notable-changes-21"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Notable Changes</h3>
<ul>
<li><strong>addons</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Fixed a memory leak for users of <code>AsyncResource</code> and N-API. (Michael Dawson) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20668">#20668</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>assert</strong>:
<ul>
<li>The <code>error</code> parameter of <code>assert.throws()</code> can be an object containing regular expressions now. (Ruben Bridgewater) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20485">#20485</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>crypto</strong>:
<ul>
<li>The <code>authTagLength</code> option has been made more flexible. (Tobias NieÃen) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20235">#20235</a>, <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20039">#20039</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>esm</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Builtin modules (e.g. <code>fs</code>) now provide named exports in ES6 modules. (Gus Caplan) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20403">#20403</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>http</strong>:
<ul>
<li>Handling of <code>close</code> and <code>aborted</code> events has been made more consistent. (Robert Nagy) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20075">#20075</a>, <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20611">#20611</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>module</strong>:
<ul>
<li>add --preserve-symlinks-main (David Goldstein) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/19911">#19911</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li><strong>timers</strong>:
<ul>
<li><code>timeout.refresh()</code> has been added to the public API. (Jeremiah Senkpiel) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20298">#20298</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Embedder support:
<ul>
<li>Functions for creating V8 <code>Isolate</code> and <code>Context</code> objects with Node.js-specific behaviour have been added to the API. (Allen Yonghuang Wang) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20639">#20639</a></li>
<li>Node.js <code>Environment</code>s clean up resources before exiting now. (Anna Henningsen) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/19377">#19377</a></li>
<li>Support for multi-threaded embedding has been improved. (Anna Henningsen) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20542">#20542</a>, <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20539">#20539</a>, <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20541">#20541</a></li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>

<li>[<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/ff619d39e6"><code>ff619d39e6</code></a>] - <strong>url</strong>: fix WHATWG host formatting error (Yichao 'Peak' Ji) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20493">#20493</a></li>
<li>[<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/1b9c40cc71"><code>1b9c40cc71</code></a>] - <strong>util</strong>: named anonymous functions (Carrie Coxwell) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20408">#20408</a></li>
<li>[<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/e854c953fd"><code>e854c953fd</code></a>] - <strong>util</strong>: improve spliceOne perf (Anatoli Papirovski) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20453">#20453</a></li>
<li>[<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/3962c734ae"><code>3962c734ae</code></a>] - <strong>util</strong>: fix isInsideNodeModules inside error (Anatoli Papirovski) <a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/20266">#20266</a></li>
</ul>
<p><a id="user-content-10.0.0"></a></p>
<h2><a id="user-content-2018-04-24-version-1000-current-jasnell" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#2018-04-24-version-1000-current-jasnell"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>2018-04-24, Version 10.0.0 (Current), @jasnell</h2>
<h3><a id="user-content-notable-changes-23" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#notable-changes-23"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Notable Changes</h3>
<ul>
<li>Assert
<ul>
<li>Calling <code>assert.fail()</code> with more than one argument is deprecated. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/70dcacd710"><code>70dcacd710</code></a>]</li>
<li>Calling <code>assert.ifError()</code> will now throw with any argument other than <code>undefined</code> or <code>null</code>. Previously the method would throw with any truthy value. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/e65a6e81ef"><code>e65a6e81ef</code></a>]</li>
<li>The <code>assert.rejects()</code> and <code>assert.doesNotReject()</code> methods have been added for working with async functions. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/599337f43e"><code>599337f43e</code></a>]</li>
<li>Assertion errors will show a diff in case objects are used. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/2d9e87695e"><code>2d9e87695e</code></a>]</li>
<li><code>assert.throws()</code> accepts an object for comparison to the error. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/2d374916eb"><code>2d374916eb</code></a>]</li>
<li>The error message from <code>assert.ok(expression)</code> now also contains the expression itself. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/f76ef50432"><code>f76ef50432</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Async_hooks
<ul>
<li>Older experimental async_hooks APIs have been removed. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/1cc6b993b9"><code>1cc6b993b9</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Buffer
<ul>
<li>Uses of <code>new Buffer()</code> and <code>Buffer()</code> outside of the <code>node_modules</code> directory will now emit a runtime deprecation warning. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/9d4ab90117"><code>9d4ab90117</code></a>]</li>
<li><code>Buffer.isEncoding()</code> now returns <code>undefined</code> for falsy values, including an empty string. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/452eed956e"><code>452eed956e</code></a>]</li>
<li><code>Buffer.fill()</code> will throw if an attempt is made to fill with an empty <code>Buffer</code>. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/1e802539b2"><code>1e802539b2</code></a>]</li>
<li><code>noAssert</code> argument was removed from all <code>Buffer</code> read and write functions. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/e8bb1f35df"><code>e8bb1f35df</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Child Process
<ul>
<li>Undefined properties of env are ignored. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/38ee25e2e2"><code>38ee25e2e2</code></a>], [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/85739b6c5b"><code>85739b6c5b</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Console
<ul>
<li>The <code>console.table()</code> method has been added. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/97ace04492"><code>97ace04492</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Crypto
<ul>
<li>The <code>crypto.createCipher()</code> and <code>crypto.createDecipher()</code> methods have been deprecated. Please use <code>crypto.createCipheriv()</code> and <code>crypto.createDecipheriv()</code> instead. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/81f88e30dd"><code>81f88e30dd</code></a>]</li>
<li>The <code>decipher.finaltol()</code> method has been deprecated. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/19f3927d92"><code>19f3927d92</code></a>]</li>
<li>The <code>crypto.DEFAULT_ENCODING</code> property has been deprecated. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/6035beea93"><code>6035beea93</code></a>]</li>
<li>The <code>ECDH.convertKey()</code> method has been added. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/f2e02883e7"><code>f2e02883e7</code></a>]</li>
<li>The <code>crypto.fips</code> property has been deprecated. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/6e7992e8b8"><code>6e7992e8b8</code></a>]</li>
<li>The AES-CCM algorithm has been implemented. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/1e07acd476"><code>1e07acd476</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Dependencies
<ul>
<li>V8 has been updated to 6.6. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/9daebb48d6"><code>9daebb48d6</code></a>]</li>
<li>OpenSSL has been updated to 1.1.0h. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/66cb29e646"><code>66cb29e646</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>EventEmitter
<ul>
<li>The <code>EventEmitter.prototype.off()</code> method has been added as an alias for <code>EventEmitter.prototype.removeListener()</code>. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/3bb6f07d52"><code>3bb6f07d52</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>File System
<ul>
<li>The <code>fs/promises</code> API provides experimental promisified versions of the <code>fs</code> functions. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/329fc78e49"><code>329fc78e49</code></a>]</li>
<li>Invalid path errors are now thrown synchronously. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/d8f73385e2"><code>d8f73385e2</code></a>]</li>
<li>The <code>fs.readFile()</code> method now partitions reads to avoid thread pool exhaustion. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/67a4ce1c6e"><code>67a4ce1c6e</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>HTTP
<ul>
<li>Processing of HTTP Status codes <code>100</code>, <code>102-199</code> has been improved. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/baf8495078"><code>baf8495078</code></a>]</li>
<li>Multi-byte characters in URL paths are now forbidden. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/b961d9fd83"><code>b961d9fd83</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>N-API
<ul>
<li>The n-api is no longer experimental. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/cd7d7b15c1"><code>cd7d7b15c1</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Net
<ul>
<li>The <code>'close'</code> event will be emitted after <code>'end'</code>. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/9b7a6914a7"><code>9b7a6914a7</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Perf_hooks
<ul>
<li>The <code>PerformanceObserver</code> class is now an <code>AsyncResource</code> and can be monitored using <code>async_hooks</code>. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/009e41826f"><code>009e41826f</code></a>]</li>
<li>Trace events are now emitted for performance events. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/9e509b622b"><code>9e509b622b</code></a>]</li>
<li>The <code>performance</code> API has been simplified. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/2ec6995555"><code>2ec6995555</code></a>]</li>
<li>Performance milestone marks will be emitted as trace events. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/96cb4fb795"><code>96cb4fb795</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Process
<ul>
<li>Using non-string values for <code>process.env</code> is deprecated. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/5826fe4e79"><code>5826fe4e79</code></a>]</li>
<li>The <code>process.assert()</code> method is deprecated. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/703e37cf3f"><code>703e37cf3f</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>REPL
<ul>
<li>REPL now experimentally supports top-level await when using the <code>--experimental-repl-await</code> flag. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/eeab7bc068"><code>eeab7bc068</code></a>]</li>
<li>The previously deprecated "magic mode" has been removed. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/4893f70d12"><code>4893f70d12</code></a>]</li>
<li>The previously deprecated <code>NODE_REPL_HISTORY_FILE</code> environment variable has been removed. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/60c9ad7979"><code>60c9ad7979</code></a>]</li>
<li>Proxy objects are shown as Proxy objects when inspected. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/90a43906ab"><code>90a43906ab</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Streams
<ul>
<li>The <code>'readable'</code> event is now always deferred with nextTick. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/1e0f3315c7"><code>1e0f3315c7</code></a>]</li>
<li>A new <code>pipeline()</code> method has been provided for building end-to-data stream pipelines. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/a5cf3feaf1"><code>a5cf3feaf1</code></a>]</li>
<li>Experimental support for async for-await has been added to <code>stream.Readable</code>. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/61b4d60c5d"><code>61b4d60c5d</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Timers
<ul>
<li>The <code>enroll()</code> and <code>unenroll()</code> methods have been deprecated. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/68783ae0b8"><code>68783ae0b8</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>TLS
<ul>
<li>The <code>tls.convertNPNProtocols()</code> method has been deprecated. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/9204a0db6e"><code>9204a0db6e</code></a>]</li>
<li>Support for NPN (next protocol negotiation) has been dropped. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/5bfbe5ceae"><code>5bfbe5ceae</code></a>]</li>
<li>The <code>ecdhCurve</code> default is now <code>'auto'</code>. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/af78840b19"><code>af78840b19</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Trace Events
<ul>
<li>A new <code>trace_events</code> top-level module allows trace event categories to be enabled/disabled at runtime. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/da5d818a54"><code>da5d818a54</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>URL
<ul>
<li>The WHATWG URL API is now a global. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/312414662b"><code>312414662b</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Util
<ul>
<li><code>util.types.is[â¦]</code> type checks have been added. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/b20af8088a"><code>b20af8088a</code></a>]</li>
<li>Support for bigint formatting has been added to <code>util.inspect()</code>. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/39dc947409"><code>39dc947409</code></a>]</li>
<li><code>util.inspect()</code> custom inspection with <code>inspect</code> property has been deprecated at runtime. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/617e3e96e6"><code>617e3e96e6</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ul>
<h4><a id="user-content-deprecations" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#deprecations"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Deprecations:</h4>
<p>The following APIs have been deprecated in Node.js 10.0.0</p>
<ul>
<li>Passing more than one argument to <code>assert.fail()</code> will emit a runtime deprecation warning. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/70dcacd710"><code>70dcacd710</code></a>]</li>
<li>Previously deprecated legacy async_hooks APIs have reached end-of-life and have been removed. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/1cc6b993b9"><code>1cc6b993b9</code></a>]</li>
<li>Using <code>require()</code> to access several of Node.js' own internal dependencies will emit a runtime deprecation. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/0e10717e43"><code>0e10717e43</code></a>]</li>
<li>The <code>crypto.createCipher()</code> and <code>crypto.createDecipher()</code> methods have been deprecated in documentation.[<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/81f88e30dd"><code>81f88e30dd</code></a>]</li>
<li>Using the <code>Decipher.finaltol()</code> method will emit a runtime deprecation warning. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/19f3927d92"><code>19f3927d92</code></a>]</li>
<li>Using the <code>crypto.DEFAULT_ENCODING</code> property will emit a runtime deprecation warning. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/6035beea93"><code>6035beea93</code></a>]</li>
<li>Use by native addons of the <code>MakeCallback()</code> variant that passes a <code>Domain</code> will emit a runtime deprecation warning. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/14bc3e22f3"><code>14bc3e22f3</code></a>], [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/efb32592e1"><code>efb32592e1</code></a>]</li>
<li>Previously deprecated internal getters/setters on <code>net.Server</code> has reached end-of-life and have been removed. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/3701b02309"><code>3701b02309</code></a>]</li>
<li>Use of non-string values for <code>process.env</code> has been deprecated in documentation. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/5826fe4e79"><code>5826fe4e79</code></a>]</li>
<li>Use of <code>process.assert()</code> will emit a runtime deprecation warning. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/703e37cf3f"><code>703e37cf3f</code></a>]</li>
<li>Previously deprecated <code>NODE_REPL_HISTORY_FILE</code> environment variable has reached end-of-life and has been removed. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/60c9ad7979"><code>60c9ad7979</code></a>]</li>
<li>Use of the <code>timers.enroll()</code> and <code>timers.unenroll()</code> methods will emit a runtime deprecation warning. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/68783ae0b8"><code>68783ae0b8</code></a>]</li>
<li>Use of the <code>tls.convertNPNProtocols()</code> method will emit a runtime deprecation warning. Support for NPN has been removed from Node.js. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/9204a0db6e"><code>9204a0db6e</code></a>]</li>
<li>The <code>crypto.fips</code> property has been deprecated in documentation. [<a href="https://github.com/nodejs/node/commit/6e7992e8b8"><code>6e7992e8b8</code></a>]</li>
</ul>
<h3><a id="user-content-commits-23" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#commits-23"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Commits</h3>
